definition: again/once more/re-/second/another/then (after sth, and not until then)/no matter how ... (followed by an adjective or verb, and then (usually) 也[ye3] or 都[dou1] for emphasis)
to compete/competition/match/to surpass/better than/superior to/to excel

sentences.english: They decided that the entire game would have to be replayed.
sentences.chinese: 他们决定整个比赛要重新再赛一次。

sentences.english: So they decided to do the last race again but to run as a team this time.
sentences.chinese: 所以，他们决定再赛一场，但这次是同队合作。

sentences.english: Georgetown and the Rockets are scheduled to play again Sunday night in Shanghai.
sentences.chinese: 乔治敦大学队和八一火箭队计划周日晚在上海再赛。

definition: to pit oneself against sb/to compete with sb/contest/battle/to haggle/to quibble
to compete/competition/match/to surpass/better than/superior to/to excel
to defeat decisively/to win decisively/great victory/triumph
to have a show-down/to fight for mastery/to compete for a championship
poised for battle/to square up for a fight
to move troops to/(fig.) to move to/to shift to
to live somewhere as a visitor/to stay with sb as a guest/to sojourn
